oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: WSM Variety Award Presentation - 1954-01-21 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: WSM program aimed at George Rosen of Variety magazine. Written by Bill Graham; engineered by Elmer Alley, Charles Bragg, Glen Snoddy, and Tom Sparkman; produced by Noel Digby. Part one of six.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Dolores Watson; Buddy Hall
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: David Cobb introduces the program -- Theme -- David Cobb talks about Variety magazine -- Ernie Keller reads from Variety magazine -- David Cobb and Ernie Keller talk about WSM -- Especially For You (excerpt) -- David Cobb talks about WSM -- Ernie Keller reads from Variety magazine -- David Cobb and Ernie Keller talk about WSM -- Ernie Keller introduces WSM's bid for a Variety award -- Love Letters In The Sand (excerpt) (Dolores Watson) -- Ernie Keller talks about Dolores Watson and Tin Pan Valley -- Ernie Keller talks about WSM -- Figures on WSM's network shows -- David Cobb and Ernie Keller talk about WSM performers -- Hey, Mr. Cotton Picker (excerpt) (Buddy Hall) -- David Cobb talks about Buddy Hall -- Ernie Keller talks about Buddy Hall replacing Snooky Lanson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Cobb, David (Announcer); Keller, Ernie; Watson, Dolores; Hall, Buddy (Singer); Especially for you (Radio program); Tin Pan Valley (Radio program); Lanson, Snooky; Sunday down south (Radio program)
